page.title: 03HALL FURNISHINGS HOUGHTON
page.content: Much of the original furniture and hangings remains at Houghton.KENT was responsible for sets of furniture, some in gesso and some in gilt and walnut.Hundreds of yards of green silk velvet,made in Italy, were used to cover furniture, and for the grand STATE BED.Red GENOA velvet covers the handsome suite in the MARBLE PARLOUR,Robert Walpole's DINING ROOM.In the SALOON ,red wool velvet from UTRECHT is used on walls and furniture. Throughout the house ceilings are decorated with scenes from classical legends.Walls in two rooms are hung with BRUSSELS tapestries,but the most outstading are the MORTLAKE ones in the TAPESTRY DRESSING ROOM.These are woven from pictures still in the ROYAL collection and are unique in that they represent STUART kings and their family.
